title: Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail: Outgoing server (SMTP) error. The server responded:  Try again later, closing connection..
content:
Not receiving GMAIL account messages.

Cannot send GMAIL account messages

Recently started receiving this error message.

"Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail: Outgoing server (SMTP) error. The server responded: Try again later, closing connection.. " -- This is the full message on screen.

Have tried all the standard "fixes" suggested on Mozilla-related help sites.

Even tried AI solutions. None work.

This happened about a week ago, as well.

Then, a couple of days after, Thunderbird came good and was working as it should.

Come this Monday, it's stopped working again, as per last week!

Is this a GOOGLE issue?

Nothing is working to solve the problem.

Now stuck with no email function on Thunderbird (Desktop PC Win 11)

NOTE: occurs on my Apple IOS, using MS Outlook, as well?!?
creator: bobbyingersoll1960

title: Can Thunderbird handle more than one Exchange mailbox
content:
I have several e-mail accounts on my own domain, via GoDaddy. They suddenly switched their e-mail server to Exchange, which forced me to switch from Thunderbird to Outlook. Can I switch back, yet, or can Tbird only handle one Exchange account?

I am temporarily using Win 10 (with security updates) but will regain access soon to a PC that can run Win 11.

title: non arrival of ticketing emails
content: I am not receiving certain emails from entertainment venues [booking confirmation, eticket.] I get other emails from the venues in question including more general ones that indicate they've received my order, and I've been able to collect tickets at the box office without a problem. I've queried this with the venues concerned and they've re-sent the messages but still without success. The mails are not being delivered to my Junk folder, and previous ticket messages from them have always reached me, as they continue to do from other venues. The theatre and the [unrelated] gallery in question can't suggest what's amiss: I can locate the bookings in my online account with each, but where are my messages going?

title: How to move one whole account out of Unified Folders
content:
I have a bunch of e-mail addresses in Unified folders, all of which are my own except one, which is for a relative on whose behalf I do a lot of things. I'd like to have that account show up completely separate from the Unified folders. Let's call that account X, for brevity.

I've favourited X's Inbox and Sent items, so I can show them outside Unified folders. So far so good.

In the Unified folders Inbox Properties, folders to search chooser, I unchecked X's Inbox and all its other folders.

This is almost what I want, except that X's account, with all its folders still all show up in Unified folders. I'd like to move them as well.

Is this possible?
creator: rbli63

title: Mozilla Thunderbird: kan geen mail meer verzenden. Zegt dat het allemaal spam is??!
content:
mailnews.smtp: Command failed: 554 SMTP602 Message contains Spam Content ;id=Kz1FvUcE7CTcAKz1FvyFIM;sid=Kz1FvUcE7CTcA;mta=csmtp6-prd-nl1-vfz;d=20251117;t=141146[CET];ipsrc=94.210.51.141;; currentAction=_actionStream SmtpClient.sys.mjs:578:19 Kan geen mail meer verzenden via Thunderbird. Volgens het systeem heb ik al teveel spam verzonden of bevat mijn mail, die ik probeer te verzenden Spam. Webmail werkt wel bij Ziggo. Mijn wachtwoord heb ik al via mijn Ziggo gewijzigd.

Ziggo kan mij niet helpen, want ondersteunen geen Mozilla

Graag spoedig commentaar. Ik loop vast in mijn werkzaamheden.

Bij voorbaat dank. Marijn tel 06 30347696

Alvast bedankt.

title: Trouble adding school Gmail address to Thunderbird
content:
Hi everyone,

I'm trying to add my school email address to Thunderbird, but I keep getting a "Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username, or password." error. I know that the username is right, and for the password, I've tried using the right password vs. leaving that field blank. For the configuration, I don't know if that's right.

The auto-configuration finds a configuration in the Mozilla ISP database, but that configuration leads me to the aforementioned error message. If the configuration is wrong, how would I go about finding the right information?

Alternatively, might it be the case that my school (the organization) has disabled using Thunderbird for our email. For any help looking into this, it's a @berkeley.edu address.

Thank you for your help!
creator: spanobo

title: Link Mismatch Detected Bypasses Proofpoint URL redirect
content: All of our email goes through Proofpoint. It has a feature that redirects all links to their URL Defense before allowing it to continue to the original destination. However, when the link is typed out in the email, Thunderbird pops up with the message that there is a Link Mismatch Detected and it lets the user go to the actual link instead of forcing it through the Proofpoint URL Defense. I need to disable that feature or create an exception for anything that redirects to Proofpoints URL.
creator: dhosley

title: ESR versons WILL AUTO UPDATE TO RELEASE VERSION  -- WHY?
content:
It appears that any ESR version will auto upgrade to the Release version right after you close the program and shut your machine down. When you go back online, surprise!, you now have 144.0.1 installed with HALF your folders missing.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1548668/edit/1779923#answer-preview

title: In Settings-Privacy-Password the TWC account is not there, asking to enter password when I open Thunderbird
content:
Hello,

I have to add the Password every time I open Thunderbird because I removed the Password myself after I read this: 

<<<< ThundaMike Mozilla Staff 7/28/25, 9:15 PM more options Sounds like you are almost there.

Building off what @david said above, try this:

In Thunderbird, go to Settings > Privacy & Security.

Scroll down to the Passwords section and click Saved Passwords….

Find your email account in the list and remove the saved password.

Restart Thunderbird.

When prompted, enter your new password. >>>

My doing this it removed the .twc password Log In totally in that Settings. I do not see the "my twc.com" in the settings of Tools, Privacy & Security, then Saved Passwords in the list, I only see the Hotmail account settings I have in Thunderbird. Removing it like ThundaMike wrote really removed all the TWC Password and Information.

Can someone help me restoring or re-enter my Mozilla Thunderbird info back into Tools, Privacy & Security, then Saved Passwords so I do not have to type in the Password every time I open Thunderbird.

Thank you so much for your time and efforts I truly appreciate it.
creator: Bibb
